nodes.text: The Day of the Sepulchral Night was a rare solar eclipse on Zelos II that occurred roughly every 120 years. When the planet's fourth moon was in line with the sun, the tides in the Great Zelosi Sea were at their lowest, which in turn gave access to Zelosian's Chine: an underwater mountain ridge.
The native Zelosians, superstitious of the event, stayed indoors for its duration.
